Package gdi.game.dominion

Class DominionTile

java.lang.Object
gdi.game.WorldObject
gdi.game.Drawable
gdi.game.map.MapTile
gdi.game.dominion.NiceTile
gdi.game.dominion.DominionTile
All Implemented Interfaces:
gdi.game.DrawableObject, gdi.game.UpdatableObject, Iterable<MapSprite>
public class DominionTile extends NiceTile
A DominionTile represents a single cell ("tile") on the map. A DominionTile can be property of a Figure. It adopts the color of its owner. A DominionTile can only have one owner at a time.

Other interesting methods accessible in this class are MapTile.getRow() and MapTile.getColumn(). Those allow you to determine where on the map a given tile was placed
Version:
2.0
Author:
Sven Huprich, Vanessa Klein
See Also:

  • MapTile.getColumn()

  • Constructor Details

    • DominionTile

      public DominionTile(MapWorld mapWorld, int col, int row)
      Creates a new DominionTile for the passed world.
      Parameters:
      mapWorld - The game's world this DominionTile lives in
      col - The column this DominionTile is located in the map
      row - The row this DominionTile is located in the map

  • Method Details

    • setOwner

      public void setOwner(Figure figure)
      Declares this DominionTile property of the passed Figure which is then the new owner of this tile.
      Parameters:
      figure - The Figure that becomes the new owner of this DominionTile.

    • isPropertyOf

      public boolean isPropertyOf(Figure figure)
      Checks whether the passed Figure is the current owner of this DominionTile.
      Parameters:
      figure - The figure that is checked for ownership of this tile.
      Returns:
      true if this tile is property of the passed figure, false otherwise.
